content.raw: I'm not entirely convinced about this change. `HasElement()` and `Get()` have a clear meaning than checking the `.first` and `.second` of a pair. I can be convinced otherwise but the first block reads better to me and looks shorter. What is the advantage of checking `value.second` compared with `HasElement()`?

I can be convinced otherwise but the first block reads better to me and looks shorter. What is the advantage of checking value.second compared with HasElement()?
